task.title: How to Use the Browser Developer Tools to Change the Figure Title Format

prereq.p: A publishing template and a customization CSS should already be set up for your transformation. See more details in the section.

context.p: This is an example of how to use the developer tools that are available in a browser to identify and modify the styling and formatting of a figure's title. The following procedure shows how to modify the separator character between the 'Figure NN' text and the figure title, and alter the caption color to be blue.

step.cmd: Start by applying the customized CSS-based PDF transformation.
step.info: After the transformation, you can see that the figure title is not colored and the delimiter between the figure number and the actual title text is the dot (".").

step.cmd: In the output folder, locate the *.merged.html file.
step.info: This file contains the contents of the entire DITA map converted to HTML. It also contains links to the customization CSS files.

step.cmd: Open the HTML file in a web browser (e.g. in Chrome).
Scroll to the figure and select some text from its title.

info.p: Now the browser changes layout and you can see the visual HTML content in the left pane and the structure of the HTML document in the middle pane.
It is possible to hover over the elements in the middle structure and see the corresponding content in the left pane.

The figure's title is placed in an HTML figcaption element. You can use the element.style in the right pane to change the selected element style. This is good for testing, but to have the styling persistent, you need to create a CSS rule in the customization CSS.

step.cmd: Open your customization CSS and add a selector that matches the figcaption element.
To change the symbol between the number of the figure and the title, you can also use the inspector and check the figure structure.
